title: Billy Ward (rugby league)
text:
William Ward (second ¼ 1888 – death unknown) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1900s, 1910s and 1920s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Whitehaven%20R.L.F.C.">Whitehaven</a>, <a href="Egremont%20Rangers%20ARLFC">Egremont</a> and <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> (for 13-years), as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a> (prior to the specialist positions of; ), during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
Background.
Billy Ward's birth was registered in <a href="Whitehaven">Whitehaven</a>, <a href="Cumberland">Cumberland</a>, England.
Playing career.
International honours.
Billy Ward won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Leeds in 1910 against Wales, in 1911 against Australia, and won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Leeds on the <a href="1910%20Great%20Britain%20Lions%20tour%20of%20Australia%20and%20New%20Zealand">1910 Great Britain Lions tour of Australia and New Zealand</a> against <a href="australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a>.
Challenge Cup Final appearances.
Billy Ward played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 13, in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 7-7 draw with <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="1909%E2%80%9310%20Challenge%20Cup">1909–10</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1909%E2%80%9310%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1909–10 season</a> at <a href="Fartown%20Ground">Fartown Ground</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Saturday 16 April 1910, in front of a crowd of 19,413, this was the first <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final to be drawn, and played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 11, in the 26-12 victory over <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="1909%E2%80%9310%20Challenge%20Cup">1909–10</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final <a href="Replay%20%28sports%29">replay</a> during the <a href="1909%E2%80%9310%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season%23Challenge%20Cup">1909–10 season</a> at <a href="Fartown%20Ground">Fartown Ground</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Monday 18 April 1910, in front of a crowd of 11,608, this was <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' first <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final win in their first appearance.
County Cup Final appearances.
Billy Ward played as a <a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Forwards">forward</a>, i.e. number 13, in <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>' 11-3 victory over <a href="Dewsbury%20Rams">Dewsbury</a> in the <a href="1921%E2%80%9322%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1921–22</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1921%E2%80%9322%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1921–22 season</a> at <a href="Thrum%20Hall">Thrum Hall</a>, <a href="Halifax%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Halifax</a> on Saturday 26 November 1921.
